verses.kjv: Moreover, brethren, we do you to wit of the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia;
verses.web: Moreover, brothers, we make known to you the grace of God which has been given in the assemblies of Macedonia,
verses.ct: Brothers, we want you to know about the grace God has given to the churches in Macedonia.

verses.kjv: How that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded unto the riches of their liberality.
verses.web: how in much proof of affliction, the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded to the riches of their generosity.
verses.ct: Even though they were going through severe hardship and crushing poverty, their overflowing joy produced an incredible wave of generosity.

verses.kjv: For to their power, I bear record, yea, and beyond their power they were willing of themselves;
verses.web: For according to their power, I testify, yes and beyond their power, they gave of their own accord,
verses.ct: I can personally testify that they gave as much as they could — and then went beyond what they could afford, entirely on their own initiative.

verses.kjv: Praying us with much intreaty that we would receive the gift, and take upon us the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.
verses.web: begging us with much entreaty to receive this grace and the fellowship in the service to the saints.
verses.ct: They actually begged us for the privilege of sharing in this gift for God's people.

verses.kjv: And this they did, not as we hoped, but first gave their own selves to the Lord, and unto us by the will of God.
verses.web: This was not as we had expected, but first they gave their own selves to the Lord, and to us through the will of God.
verses.ct: What they did went far beyond what we expected. First, they gave themselves to the Lord, and then to us, because that was God's will.

verses.kjv: Insomuch that we desired Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also finish in you the same grace also.
verses.web: So we urged Titus, that as he had made a beginning before, so he would also complete in you this grace.
verses.ct: So we urged Titus — since he had already started this work among you — to help you complete this same act of grace.

verses.kjv: Therefore, as ye abound in every thing, in faith, and utterance, and knowledge, and in all diligence, and in your love to us, see that ye abound in this grace also.
verses.web: But as you abound in everything, in faith, utterance, knowledge, all earnestness, and in your love to us, see that you also abound in this grace.
verses.ct: You already excel in so many things: in faith, in speech, in knowledge, in wholehearted dedication, and in your love for us. Now make sure you also excel in this act of generosity.

verses.kjv: I speak not by commandment, but by occasion of the forwardness of others, and to prove the sincerity of your love.
verses.web: I speak not by way of commandment, but as proving through the earnestness of others the sincerity also of your love.
verses.ct: I'm not giving you an order. But by pointing to the eagerness of others, I'm giving you a chance to prove that your love is genuine.

verses.kjv: For ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that ye through his poverty might be rich.
verses.web: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that you through his poverty might become rich.
verses.ct: You already know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ: though he was rich, he became poor for your sake, so that through his poverty you could become rich.

verses.kjv: And herein I give my advice: for this is expedient for you, who have begun before, not only to do, but also to be forward a year ago.
verses.web: I give a judgment in this: for this is expedient for you who were the first to start a year ago, not only to do, but also to be willing.
verses.ct: Here's my advice — and it's for your own benefit: a year ago, you were the first not only to start giving but also to want to give.

verses.kjv: Now therefore perform the doing of it; that as there was a readiness to will, so there may be a performance also out of that which ye have.
verses.web: But now complete the doing also, that as there was the readiness to be willing, so there may be the completion also out of your ability.
verses.ct: Now it's time to finish what you started. You were so eager to begin — now match that eagerness by completing the work with whatever you have.

verses.kjv: For if there be first a willing mind, it is accepted according to that a man hath, and not according to that he hath not.
verses.web: For if the readiness is there, it is acceptable according to what you have, not according to what you don’t have.
verses.ct: If you're truly willing to give, God accepts your gift based on what you have, not on what you don't have.

verses.kjv: For I mean not that other men be eased, and ye burdened:
verses.web: For this is not that others may be eased and you distressed,
verses.ct: I'm not trying to make life easy for others while making it hard for you.

verses.kjv: But by an equality, that now at this time your abundance may be a supply for their want, that their abundance also may be a supply for your want: that there may be equality:
verses.web: but for equality. Your abundance at this present time supplies their lack, that their abundance also may become a supply for your lack; that there may be equality.
verses.ct: The goal is fairness. Right now, your abundance can meet their need. And someday, their abundance may meet yours. That way, things balance out.

verses.kjv: As it is written, He that had gathered much had nothing over; and he that had gathered little had no lack.
verses.web: As it is written, “He who gathered much had nothing left over, and he who gathered little had no lack.”
verses.ct: As Scripture says, "The one who gathered a lot didn't end up with too much, and the one who gathered only a little didn't go without."

verses.kjv: But thanks be to God, which put the same earnest care into the heart of Titus for you.
verses.web: But thanks be to God, who puts the same earnest care for you into the heart of Titus.
verses.ct: Thank God — he put the same deep concern for you into the heart of Titus.

verses.kjv: For indeed he accepted the exhortation; but being more forward, of his own accord he went unto you.
verses.web: For he indeed accepted our exhortation, but being himself very earnest, he went out to you of his own accord.
verses.ct: Titus not only accepted our request, but he was so eager that he decided to come to you on his own.

verses.kjv: And we have sent with him the brother, whose praise is in the gospel throughout all the churches;
verses.web: We have sent together with him the brother whose praise in the Good News is known throughout all the assemblies.
verses.ct: Along with him, we're sending a brother who is widely praised among all the churches for his work in spreading the gospel.

verses.kjv: And not that only, but who was also chosen of the churches to travel with us with this grace, which is administered by us to the glory of the same Lord, and declaration of your ready mind:
verses.web: Not only so, but he was also appointed by the assemblies to travel with us in this grace, which is served by us to the glory of the Lord himself, and to show our readiness.
verses.ct: Beyond that, the churches chose him to travel with us as we carry out this generous gift — a service that brings glory to the Lord and demonstrates our eagerness to help.

verses.kjv: Avoiding this, that no man should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us:
verses.web: We are avoiding this, that any man should blame us concerning this abundance which is administered by us.
verses.ct: We're being careful so that no one can criticize how we handle this large contribution.

verses.kjv: Providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.
verses.web: Having regard for honorable things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men.
verses.ct: We want to do what is right — not only in the Lord's eyes, but also in the eyes of everyone watching.

verses.kjv: And we have sent with them our brother, whom we have oftentimes proved diligent in many things, but now much more diligent, upon the great confidence which I have in you.
verses.web: We have sent with them our brother, whom we have many times proved earnest in many things, but now much more earnest, by reason of the great confidence which he has in you.
verses.ct: We're also sending another brother along with them. We've tested his dedication many times in many situations, and now he's even more eager because of his great confidence in you.

verses.kjv: Whether any do enquire of Titus, he is my partner and fellowhelper concerning you: or our brethren be enquired of, they are the messengers of the churches, and the glory of Christ.
verses.web: As for Titus, he is my partner and fellow worker for you. As for our brothers, they are the apostles of the assemblies, the glory of Christ.
verses.ct: As for Titus, he's my partner and coworker in serving you. As for the other brothers, they are representatives of the churches and a reflection of Christ's glory.

verses.kjv: Wherefore shew ye to them, and before the churches, the proof of your love, and of our boasting on your behalf.
verses.web: Therefore show the proof of your love to them before the assemblies, and of our boasting on your behalf.
verses.ct: So show them the proof of your love, and show all the churches that our pride in you is well deserved.
